meanings.definition: To carry out or accomplish (a task or duty)
meanings.sent1: She will fulfil her promise to help with the project.
meanings.sent2: He always fulfils his responsibilities at work.
meanings.sent3: The robot was programmed to fulfil its cleaning duties, but it started dancing instead!
meanings.sent4: Watching the sunrise every morning helps fulfil a sense of peace within me.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's guidance helped fulfil the students' potential in the classroom.

meanings.definition: To satisfy or meet (a need or requirement)
meanings.sent1: Eating a nutritious meal can fulfil your hunger.
meanings.sent2: The company aims to fulfil the demands of its customers.
meanings.sent3: The magician used a trick to fulfil the audience's desire for amazement.
meanings.sent4: A good book can fulfil the need for adventure without leaving home.
meanings.sent5: The warm soup managed to fulfil both hunger and comfort on a cold day.
